title: 2x1 - $1,700 - Move In September 1st!
app_fee: $35 App fee per adult        Holding deposit $300
posting_body: Cambridge Park Villa Apartments
6801 S. 133rd St Seattle, WA 98178
show contact info
We can provide a tour of a similar unit!
Call to schedule.
Office Hours:
Monday-Friday: 10:00am-6:00pm
Saturday: 11:00am-3:00pm
Sunday: Closed
Please call beforehand to ensure availability and/or schedule appointment to apply!
We take applications in office and operate on a first come, first served basis.
We have the following unit available for PRELEASE:
- 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom //
950 sq ft // $1,700 per month //
A Building //
First Floor, Corner Unit //
Pet Friendly //
Hardwood  // Move In August 26th!
Assigned garage parking spot and gravel parking lot spot for purchase
- FULL SIZED WASHER & DRYER IN-UNIT
- GAS FIREPLACE
- FULL SIZED KITCHEN WITH FULL SIZED APPLIANCES
- DISHWASHER
- LOTS OF LARGE, DEEP CABINENTS FOR DRY FOOD STORAGE
- GARBAGE DISPOSAL
- LARGE, DEEP BATHTUB
- BALCONY
- SPACIOUS FLOOR PLAN
- ENTRY CLOSET
- LARGE CLOSET IN MASTER BED
- CLOTHING ARMOIRE INSTALLED ONTO WALL IN SECOND BEDROOM
- 2 ASSIGNED GARAGE PARKING SPOTS (GARAGE IS ATTACHED TO THE BUILDING)
- Inside Entry Building (Hotel Style)
- Gated Community
- Key/Intercom Access Building
- Pool
- Gym
- On-site Management Office and on-site Management
- Rentable Event Space in Clubhouse
- Mail Center
- Less than 2 miles from the I5 freeway
- 1.5 miles from Fred Meyer/Safeway Shopping Center
- 2.5 miles from The Landing Renton and the 405 freeway
- City Transit Bus Line steps away from property
For 2 bedroom units, we offer 2 parking spots total.
At no point in time will we have the ability to assign a third.
Parking is charged per spot per month:
- $35/month for an outside parking spot
- $60/month with a $50 remote deposit for inside the garage (garage is in the same building as the unit)
Each parking spot inside the community is assigned to each unit.
Additional/guest parking is on 133rd Street outside of the community, with a walk-on staircase.
Utilities (Water/Sewer/Garbage) are charged at a flat rate per occupant: $80 for the first occupant + $30 for each additional occupant (children and babies included).
The maximum number of occupants allowed in this residence is 5.
To financially qualify, your monthly income must be 3x the monthly rent, plus utilities.
Example:
- Utilities for: 1 person = $80, 2 people = $110, 3 people = $140, 4 people = $170, 5 people = $200
- $1,700 + utilities = TOTAL x 3 = what all applicant's combined gross monthly income must be
You will receive an automatic denial if:
- Your FICO credit score is below 600 points
- You have any evictions, bankruptcies, felonies, and/or violent/sexual convictions
- If you smoke.
THIS IS A NON-SMOKING COMMUNITY - IF YOU SMOKE PLEASE REFRAIN FROM APPLYING, AS YOU MUST WALK
ENTIRELY OFF THE PROPERTY TO SMOKE.
Smoking is grounds for eviction.
- Application Fee: $35/adult.
We require that all adults apply.
- Holding Fee (at the time of application): $300
This holds the unit during your application process and we expect that if approved, you move in within two weeks of approval (unless there is a pre-leasing arrangement).
If you are approved, this $300 holding fee goes towards your move in costs ($150 towards the non-refundable administration fee and $150 towards your security deposit).
If denied, this is returned to you.
If you are approved and change your mind, the holding fee is non-refundable, as compensation for the time it was off market for you.
If approved, your security deposit could be $500 up to a full month's rent, depending on your application screening results.
We require renter's insurance upon move-in.
We will send you these details at the time of approval.
Electricity is metered through Seattle City Light.
Gas (exclusively for your fireplace) is metered through Puget Sound Energy.
These bills are yours to pay these companies personally.
Upon move-in, management will set you up with these accounts.
There are internet/cable hookups at your convenience and you are able to choose your provider-
this account is the tenant's responsibility to set up, if desired.
